It is shown that excommunication can only harm a man in so far as he has previously been harmed by his own sin. Fora real excommunication there must be a special revelation, and those who employ this weapon srom interested motives must beware lest it recoil on themselves. ln all scripture we can find no instance os excommunication save ( 1) by way of punishment to save the soul of the sinner‚ (2) by way os handing over to Satan those who are already his own, and are harming the Church, (3) by way of forbidding intercourse with those who are impenitent after a triple exhortation, (4) as a general malediction against evil- doers. lt is the third kind of excommunication which is used and unscripturally extended by our prelates, who tum the triple exhortation into atriple summons to pay, and sacrifice the whole medicinal power of their sentences sor pecuniary gain. Such excommunicatione ought not to be supported by imprisonment, and, with one of the few touches of humour in the treatise‚ Wyclis grimly quotes the words oi the layman who told the excommunicating priest that his medicine was so bad that in future he might keep it sor himself.
